Class ArrayLists

java.lang.Object
  ArrayLists

public class ArrayLists
extends java.lang.Object

In this project you will learn to use the ArrayList class. Some of the problems below are ones that we've seen in the past. Don't just copy/paste from your original solution, solve it again! It's good practice. First you will complete each method using an array. Next you will complete the the same method immediately following the array problem except this time you will use an ArrayList.

Version:
Unit 6
Author:
(your name)

byTwoArray

public static int[] byTwoArray(int firstNumber,
                               int count)
Given a starting number, return an array of integers starting with the first number. The array will consist of the number of elements specified by "count". The first element of the array is firstNumber and each subsequent number counts up by 2.

Parameters:
firstNumber - is the value of the first element of the returned array
count - is the number of elements to include in the returned array
Returns:
the array of count elements, starting with firstNumber and counting up by 2

Parameters:

count - is the number of elements to include in the returned List
Returns:

Returns:

Parameters:

index - The index of the value to return the value
Returns:
the value at the index position, -1 if the index is out of bounds of the array

replaceAboveTarget

Parameters:

target - the maximimum allowable value in the array.
Returns:
a new array of doubles that has values greater than target changed to -1.0
